abstract: Queries whether changing between the specified and current trait collections would affect color values.
overview:
## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the colors in the two trait collections differ, or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] if they have the same component values.

## Discussion

Use this method to determine whether changing the traits of the current environment would also change the colors in your interface. For example, changing the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITraitCollection/userInterfaceStyle] or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITraitCollection/accessibilityContrast] property usually changes the colors of your interface.

# hasDifferentColorAppearance(comparedTo:)

**Instance Method**

Queries whether changing between the specified and current trait collections would affect color values.

## Declaration

```swift
func hasDifferentColorAppearance(comparedTo traitCollection: UITraitCollection?) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **traitCollection**: A trait collection that you want to compare to the current trait collection.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the colors in the two trait collections differ, or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] if they have the same component values.

## Discussion

Use this method to determine whether changing the traits of the current environment would also change the colors in your interface. For example, changing the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITraitCollection/userInterfaceStyle] or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITraitCollection/accessibilityContrast] property usually changes the colors of your interface.

## Comparing trait collections

- **containsTraits(in:)**: Queries whether a trait collection contains all of another trait collection’s values.
